meanings.definition: A person who makes a fuss or causes trouble.
meanings.sent1: The fussers complained about the food at the party.
meanings.sent2: The fussers in the group always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent3: The fussers at the office made a big deal out of the broken coffee machine.
meanings.sent4: The fussers in the neighborhood stirred up trouble with their constant complaints.
meanings.sent5: The fussers in the class were known for their constant nitpicking and grumbling.

meanings.definition: Plural form of fusser, referring to multiple individuals who make a fuss.
meanings.sent1: The fussers gathered outside the store, demanding a refund.
meanings.sent2: The fussers at the meeting kept interrupting the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The fussers in the park argued loudly over a lost ball.
meanings.sent4: The fussers in the family always find something to disagree about.
meanings.sent5: The fussers in the group caused chaos with their constant demands and complaints.
